Key Arguments: The legislation exempts the government and mainstream media, which is seen as discriminatory.
The government and mainstream media were sources of misinformation during the recent health emergency.
The bill is compared to restrictions in totalitarian states and is seen as undermining freedom of speech.
Defining misinformation is subjective and should not be controlled by a small group like ACMA.
Excessive power in the hands of few can lead to censorship and suppression of alternative information.
Notable Quotes: This proposed Bill embodies the sort of restrictions that have occurred in totalitarian states like North Korea and Stalin’s Russia.
Such excessive power will lead to censorship of the type that occurred in the recent ‘health emergency’.
